com.projetloki.genesis

Class Properties

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.Properties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertiesOrBuilder

    public final class Properties
extends Object
implements PropertiesOrBuilder
    An immutable set of CSS properties.

    There are two ways to construct an instance. You can either set properties one by one using a builder, or directly pass the CSS code to the from method. Example: 

     Properties props1 = Properties.builder()
     .setColor(Color.BLACK)
     .setMarginPx(2, 4)
     .setWidthPx(100)
     .build();

 Properties props2 = Properties.from(
     "color: #000;" +
     "margin: 2px 4px;" +
     "width: 100px");

 assertEquals(props1, props2);

    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux

    • Method Detail

      • from

        public static Properties from(String propertiesString)
        Constructs a new instance from a sequence of semicolon-separated name:value CSS properties. Does not perform any kind of validation beyond grammar check. For example, calling from("border-width=2px") will fail because the name-value separator must be a colon, but calling from("border-width:black") will succeed.

        The input string can contain CSS comments, though they will be discarded. There can be a semicolon after the last name:value property, but this is not required.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input string is not a grammatically-correct sequence of semicolon-separated name:value CSS properties
